summary: CONSUMER STATES DAMAGED/RECALLED REFRIGERATOR IN 2003 KEYSTONE MONTANA RV *TGW  THE CONSUMER STATED THE REFRIGERATOR WAS WORKING FINE WITH NO ISSUES PRIOR TO THE RECALL. THE CONSUMER RECEIVED THE RECALL NOTICE, FOLLOWED THE INSTRUCTIONS VERBATIM AND HAD THE UNIT SERVICED. THE CONSUMER WAS ADVISED TO LEAVE THE REFRIGERATOR RUNNING FOR SEVERAL HOURS AS IT WOULD GET COLD AGAIN. HOWEVER, IT NEVER WORKED AGAIN. THE SERVICE TECHNICIAN DID ACKNOWLEDGE, THERE WAS YELLOW FLUID LEAKING FROM A CRACK IN THE BOILER BOX.   *JB

2003 KEYSTONE MONTANA FIFTH WHEEL CAMPER. CONSUMER STATES THAT HE HAS HAD EXCESSIVE TIRE WEAR AND AXLES WERE NOT ABLE TO BE ALIGNED AND NEEDED TO BE REPLACED *TGW  THE CONSUMER TOOK THE RV TO AN ALIGNMENT SHOP AND WAS TOLD THE AXLES WERE BAD AND THE RV COULD NOT BE ALIGNED AND THEREFORE, THE AXLES NEEDED TO BE REPLACED. *JB
2003 MONTANA 5TH WHEEL BURNT DUE TO A DOMETIC REFRIGERATOR. CONSUMER STATES THAT THE FIRE DEPARTMENT STATED THAT THE FIRE STARTED IN OR AROUND THE REFRIGERATOR.  *KB
